statement.p: What is the area of this floor in square feet?

solution.p: This floor area consists of a rectangular area (on the left) and a triangular area (on the right). First measurements should all be converted to the same unit.
Top edge: \displaystyle{12}\ \text{ ft}\cdot\frac{{{12}\ \text{ in}}}{{{1}\ \text{ ft}}}+{7}\ \text{ in}={151}\ \text{ in}
Left edge: \displaystyle{6}\ \text{ ft}\cdot\frac{{{12}\ \text{ in}}}{{{1}\ \text{ ft}}}+{3}\ \text{ in}={75}\ \text{ in}
Bottom edge: \displaystyle{5}\ \text{ ft}\cdot\frac{{{12}\ \text{ in}}}{{{1}\ \text{ ft}}}+{1}\ \text{ in}={61}\ \text{ in}
We do not need the length of the right edge (angled).
The area of the rectangle is \displaystyle{\left({75}\ \text{ in}\right)}{\left({61}\ \text{ in}\right)}={4575}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}.

The triangles top edge has length \displaystyle{\left({151}\ \text{ in}\right)}-{\left({61}\ \text{ in}\right)}={90}\ \text{ in}. The left edge is 75 in. Thus the area of the triangle is \displaystyle\frac{{1}}{{2}}{\left({75}\ \text{ in}\right)}{\left({90}\ \text{ in}\right)}={3375}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}.

Thus the total area is \displaystyle{4575}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}+{3375}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}={7950}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}. Converting this to square feet it becomes \displaystyle{7950}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}\cdot{\left(\frac{{{1}\ \text{ ft}}}{{{12}\ \text{ in}}}\right)}^{{2}}=\frac{{7950}}{{144}}\ \text{ ft}^{{2}}={55.208333333333}\ \text{ ft}^{{2}}\approx{55}\ \text{ ft}^{{2}}.
